intro: Pariana nervata, commonly known as the narrow-veined pariana, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and heart-shaped leaves with prominent venation. Its flowers are typically small, pink or white, and are clustered in inflorescences. Pariana nervata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
